description: Alterations to scheme granted listed building consent reference 19/01212/LBC, to include the proposed changes:- Changes to the proposed roof of the Lambeth Coal Store;- Omission of the glazed flooring panel within the Lambeth Coal Store;- Partial demolition of the concrete hopper structure below the Lambeth Coal Store;- Further alterations to the Lambeth Office;- Replacement Substation and associated enclosure- Insertion of ventilation louvres onto the eastern elevation of the Chelsea Cole Store- Modifications to cycle storage units

decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to beneficial use of the Lambeth Coal Store, details of the strategy for the public display of the heritage of the site, including archival drawings and photographs to be displayed within the building, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed scheme shall be displayed within the Lambeth Coal Store at all times, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

A) The development shall be completed in accordance with the key design details secured under condition 4 parts 01, 02, 04, 05, 06, 07, 08, 09, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17  and 19  of listed building consent 19/01212/LBC, as approved and  discharged under application reference:  20/02704/CLC, 20/01516/CLC,  20/01509/CLC, 20/01441/CLC, 20/01366/CLC, 20/00338/CLC, 20/02704/CLC, 20/00276/CLC, 20/00277/CLC, 20/00165/CLC, 19/03074/CLC, 19/03075/CLC, 19/03073/CLC, 19/03079/CLC, 19/03076/CLC, 19/03077/CLC, 19/03078/CLC, 19/02808/CLC.B) The following parts of  Condition  4 of of listed building consent 19/01212/LBC remain outstanding, and should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing within 8 weeks  from the date of the listed building hereby granted: 4.03 Details of installation of foundations for mezzanine structure at Chelsea Coal Store, details for associated paving reinstatement plan and treatment at interface with listed building flagstone paving and any other relevant envelope. Details to be submitted before works commence;4.16. Details of replacement gate design for steps leading to basement at Lambeth Coal Store. Information to be submitted before refurbishment of the element to commence. 4. 18. Details of alterations to external steps leading to basement at Lambeth Coal Store to be submitted before refurbishment of this element commences. 4. 20. Structural condition of bell tower and resultant repair strategy to be submitted before refurbishment works commence on Reception Building.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the details and recommendations set out within the accompanying Heritage Statement prepared by Built Heritage Consultancy (October 2021). Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The tunnels connected to the coal store shall be secured but remain accessible during the works and after their completion, so that inspection, investigation and maintenance remain possible now and in the future. Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
